title: Jimmy Fallon Injures Hand in Fall
text:
Jimmy Fallon Injures Hand in Fall Posted just a moment ago 
James White/NBC (NEW YORK) -- Jimmy Fallon landed in the emergency room with an injury to his hand on Saturday, four months after severely injuring the other one. 
The Tonight Show host was in Cambridge, Massachusetts, to receive the Elmer Award for Excellence in Humor from the Harvard Lampoon , Harvard University’s humor magazine. During the festivities, Fallon tripped and fell, leading to a trip to Massachusetts General Hospital. 
A source assures People magazine that "everything is totally fine," explaining, "It was all part of the celebration in the street and some random girl kneeled down in front of him abruptly as he was turning around and he tripped over her because he didn't see her." 
"Jimmy went to the ground, and everybody asked if he was OK," an eyewitness tells the magazine. "He said he was fine." 
Cambridge police reportedly helped Fallon back up, and he took off in his limo and headed straight for the hospital. 
"Nothing that a few band aids couldn't fix," Fallon, 41, later wrote on Instagram , alongside a photo of his right hand, which had two bandages on it. 
Oct 25, 2015 at 11:24am PDT 
However, another picture posted by a party-goer -- apparently since taken down -- showed the comedian's hand heavily bandaged. 
One fan managed to catch Fallon’s flop on video and posted it on Instagram. 
Oct 24, 2015 at 6:52pm PDT 
Fallon nearly severed his finger in a fall at his home this summer.
